title: 1 man dead, 3 others injured after Raceland house party ends in shooting
content:
RACELAND, La. —
One man is dead after a house party turned violent early Sunday morning in Raceland, Lafourche Parish authorities said.
Tra'von Folse, 20, died from his injuries after he was shot in the abdomen. Three other men were also wounded, according the Lafourche Parish Sheriff's Office.
Deputies received reports around 12:45 a.m. about multiple people being shot at a house party on Market Street.
Folse was taken to a hospital, where he died. A 23-year-old man was shot in the neck and was taken to a New Orleans hospital. He remains in stable condition.
Officials said a 20-year-old man was shot in the rear, while a 24-year-old man was also shot in the neck. Both were treated and released.
The investigation into the shooting is ongoing. Additional information about the investigation has not been released by the LPSO.
Anyone with information about what happened at the house party is asked to call Crime Stoppers Bayou Region at 800-743-7433.
